title: 'They wanted me dead': Bengaluru cop's note mirrors techie Subhash Atul's suicide case - The Times of India
Maharashtra Cabinet's Swearing-in Underway: BJP's Bawankule, Pankaja Munde Take Oath As Ministers - News18
summary:
Maharashtra Cabinet Expansion: BJP Gets 19 Ministers, 11 From Shiv Sena, 9 From NCP

Publication Date: December 15, 2024, 23:47 IST
Source: News18

Maharashtra Cabinet Expansion: The Cabinet expansion of the new BJP-led Maharashtra government took place on Sunday as 39 ministers from the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), Shiv Sena (Shinde faction) and Nationalist Congress Party (Ajit Pawar) took oath at Raj Bhavan in Nagpur.

  • The cabinet includes 19 ministers from the BJP, 11 from Shiv Sena (Shinde faction), and nine from NCP (Ajit Pawar).
  • This expansion occurred 10 days after Devendra Fadnavis was sworn in as Chief Minister following a decisive mandate in the November Assembly elections.
  • Deputy Chief Ministers Eknath Shinde and Ajit Pawar were confirmed alongside the new ministers.
  • Key ministers from the BJP included state unit chief Chandrashekhar Bawankule and Pankaja Munde.
  • Ajit Pawar’s NCP welcomed several new faces among their appointed ministers.
  • The assembly session commences on December 16, following this cabinet expansion.
"The Mahayuti may drop underperforming ministers, which could include 4 leaders from the Shinde camp, 3 from the BJP, and 2 from Ajit Pawar faction." - Sources to News18

In conclusion, the cabinet expansion reflects the BJP's consolidation of power in Maharashtra, with a significant representation from their coalition partners as they prepare for the upcoming Assembly session.

title: "If Pranab Mukherjee Were PM...": Mani Shankar Aiyar On Congress' 2014 Rout - NDTV
summary:
If Pranab Mukherjee Were PM...: Mani Shankar Aiyar On Congress' 2014 Rout

Publication Date: September 1, 2020

Source: NDTV

The article discusses comments made by Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar regarding the impact Pranab Mukherjee could have had on the Congress party's performance in the 2014 general elections if he had been Prime Minister instead of Dr. Manmohan Singh.

  • Aiyar believes that Pranab Mukherjee as Prime Minister during UPA-II would have changed the outcome of the 2014 elections.
  • The Congress party faced its worst performance, winning only 44 seats, attributed to "no governance" in 2013.
  • Pranab Mukherjee, who had significant charisma and energy, could have better led the party and government.
  • Aiyar compares Congress's 2014 defeat to its peak of 414 seats in 1984.
  • The absence of effective governance in 2013 made it difficult for Congress to counter BJP's attacks.

"A party that had been at 414 in December 1984 had fallen by 2014 to 44 seats. That is because there was no governance in 2013..."

In conclusion, Aiyar reflects on the potential different paths the Congress party could have taken if Pranab Mukherjee had been at the helm, suggesting it might have resulted in a better electoral outcome.

title: Devendra Fadnavis cabinet takes oath in Nagpur - Meet the new Maharashtra ministers - The Times of India
‘My political career made, unmade by Gandhis’, says Congress veteran Mani Shankar Aiyar - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘My political career made, unmade by Gandhis’, says Congress veteran Mani Shankar Aiyar

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Senior Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar has expressed that his political career has been significantly influenced by the Gandhi family, both positively and negatively, and has offered insights on the party's leadership decisions over the years.

  • Aiyar claims his political career was “made and unmade” by the Gandhi family.
  • He stated that he had limited personal interactions with Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, and Priyanka Gandhi.
  • Aiyar believes if Pranab Mukherjee had become Prime Minister in 2012, the Congress would have performed better in the 2014 elections.
  • He recalled feeling surprised when Sonia Gandhi remarked, "I’m not a Christian" during a Christmas greeting.
  • Aiyar's upcoming book 'A Maverick in Politics' discusses these political dynamics and his experiences.
“The irony of my life is that my political career was made by the Gandhis and unmade by the Gandhis.”

In conclusion, Aiyar reflects on his complex relationship with the Gandhi family while emphasizing the pivotal role of Pranab Mukherjee's potential leadership in Congress's political fortunes.

title: Man In Bihar Dies After Mob Thrashes Him All Night On Suspicion Of Theft - NDTV
Allahabad HC judge Justice Shekhar Yadav likely to face SC collegium over remarks at VHP event - Hindustan Times
summary:
Allahabad HC judge Justice Shekhar Yadav likely to face SC collegium over remarks at VHP event

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Justice Shekhar Yadav of the Allahabad High Court faces scrutiny over controversial remarks made at a VHP event, with the Supreme Court collegium requesting a report on his statements.

  • Justice Yadav spoke at a VHP event on December 8, discussing the aim of the Uniform Civil Code.
  • He made controversial statements about the law functioning according to majority wishes, which were circulated on social media.
  • Opposition leaders labeled his remarks as “hate speech,” leading to calls for his impeachment by over 55 MPs in the Rajya Sabha.
  • Senior lawyer Prashant Bhushan has requested an in-house inquiry into Justice Yadav's conduct.
  • The Supreme Court has requested details from the Allahabad High Court regarding the incident.
"A strong institutional response is needed to restore public faith in the judiciary," - Prashant Bhushan

The situation surrounding Justice Yadav highlights significant concerns about judicial integrity and the expectations of impartiality within the judiciary, prompting calls for accountability.

title: "Can't Say You Don't Like EVMs Because...": Ally Junks Congress' Charge - NDTV
summary:
"Can't Say You Don't Like EVMs Because...": Ally Junks Congress' Charge

Publication Date: October 16, 2024

Source: NDTV

Omar Abdullah, Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister and member of the National Conference, criticized Congress for its inconsistent stance on Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs), emphasizing that such questioning should be consistent.

  • Omar Abdullah stated it is wrong to question EVMs only when results are unfavorable.
  • He mentioned that if parties distrust EVMs, they should refrain from contesting elections.
  • Abdullah highlighted his own electoral experiences, noting he never blamed EVMs for election outcomes.
  • The National Conference performed well in recent Jammu and Kashmir Assembly polls, winning 48 out of 95 seats.
  • Abdullah praised infrastructure initiatives by the Modi government, contrasting with Congress's critiques.
  • His remarks reflect a potential rift within the INDIA alliance, particularly concerning Congress's leadership role.
"When you get a hundred plus members of Parliament using the same EVMs... you can't then a few months later turn around and say... we don't like these EVMs because now the election results aren't going the way we would like them to." - Omar Abdullah

Abdullah's comments underline the complexities within the opposition alliance and suggest a call for greater consistency and self-reflection among its members regarding electoral integrity and leadership dynamics.

title: Lok Sabha defeats Rajya Sabha in Tuberculosis-awareness friendly cricket match - India Today
summary:
Lok Sabha defeats Rajya Sabha in Tuberculosis-awareness friendly cricket match

Published On: Dec 15, 2024

Source: India Today

The TB awareness match featured Lok Sabha Speaker's XI and Rajya Sabha Chairman's XI, aiming to raise awareness against tuberculosis through a friendly cricket match in New Delhi.

  • Lok Sabha Speaker's XI won by 73 runs, scoring 192 runs.
  • Former Sports Minister Anurag Singh Thakur scored 111 runs, leading his team to victory.
  • BJP MP Nishikant Dubey was named best fielder, and Congress MP Deepender Singh Hooda was the best bowler.
  • Manoj Tiwari won the Super Catch award during the match.
  • The match emphasized the importance of TB awareness and health initiatives among MPs.

"TB is a serious disease, and raising awareness is the most effective way to combat it." - Anurag Thakur

"Our mantra is TB free India and Fit India Movement." - Kiren Rijiju

The event successfully blended sports and social responsibility, showcasing the MPs' commitment to combating tuberculosis through public awareness initiatives.

title: ‘If you have problems with EVMs…': Omar Abdullah's salvo at INDIA ally Congress - Hindustan Times
summary:
If you have problems with EVMs…: Omar Abdullah's salvo at INDIA ally Congress

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 04:21 PM IST

Source: Hindustan Times

Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah criticized the Congress party's stance on Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs), arguing that they cannot reject EVMs after losses while celebrating wins with the same machines.

  • Abdullah addressed the Congress's doubts about EVMs following defeats in the Haryana and Maharashtra Assembly polls.
  • He stated that one cannot selectively trust EVMs based on election outcomes.
  • Abdullah encouraged parties to remain consistent in their views on voting mechanisms.
  • He defended the Central Vista project, stating it was necessary for a new Parliament building.
  • Reports indicate rising tension between the National Conference (NC) and Congress, particularly after recent elections in Jammu and Kashmir.
"When you get a hundred plus members of Parliament using the same EVMs, and you celebrate that as sort of a victory for your party, you can't then a few months later turn around and say... we don't like these EVMs because now the election results aren't going the way we would like them to." — Omar Abdullah

Abdullah's comments indicate growing friction within the INDIA alliance and highlight the need for party leaders to consistently support their electoral processes. His advocacy for principles over partisan loyalty bolsters his political stance amid rising tensions.

title: "My Career Made, Then Unmade By Gandhis": Mani Shankar Aiyar's Big Claim - NDTV
summary:
My Career Made, Then Unmade By Gandhis: Mani Shankar Aiyar's Big Claim

Date: Not specified Source: Press Trust of India

Senior Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar has claimed that the Gandhi family played a significant role in both his political rise and subsequent marginalization within the party.

  • Aiyar stated, "The irony of my life is that my political career was made by the Gandhis and unmade by the Gandhis."
  • He expressed frustration over a lack of substantial engagement with key members of the Gandhi family over the years.
  • Aiyar mentioned he did not have the opportunity to meet Sonia Gandhi for a decade and had only limited interactions with Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi.
  • He recalled needing to ask Priyanka to convey birthday wishes to Rahul during a period of his suspension from the party.
  • Aiyar wrote a letter to Rahul Gandhi seeking clarity on his suspension but received no acknowledgment.
  • He reflected on the political environment in 2012 during crises for both Sonia Gandhi and former PM Manmohan Singh, noting Pranab Mukherjee's potential leadership during that time.
“For 10 years, I was not given an opportunity to meet Sonia Gandhi one-on-one. I was not given an opportunity, except once, of spending any meaningful time with Rahul Gandhi.”

This interview sheds light on the complex dynamics within the Congress party and highlights Aiyar's personal experiences regarding his political journey influenced by the Gandhi family.

title: Delhi Assembly polls: AAP releases final candidates’ list, Arvind Kejriwal to contest from New Delhi, Atishi from Kalkaji - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi Assembly polls: AAP releases final candidates’ list, Arvind Kejriwal to contest from New Delhi, Atishi from Kalkaji

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The AAP on Sunday released its final list of candidates for the upcoming Delhi Assembly polls, marking a significant step as the party aims for a third consecutive term in power.

  • The party announced a total of 38 candidates.
  • Arvind Kejriwal will contest from the New Delhi constituency.
  • Chief Minister Atishi is fielded from Kalkaji.
  • Ministers will contest from various constituencies including Greater Kailash and Babarpur.
  • The 2020 election saw AAP securing 62 out of 70 seats.

Here is our fourth and final list for upcoming Delhi Elections ‼️

Congratulations to all the candidates 🎉

फिर लायेंगे केजरीवाल 🔥💯

— AAP (@AamAadmiParty) December 15, 2024

The upcoming polls are anticipated to be a crucial test for AAP's governance model and its connection with the electorate.

Aaditya Thackeray's request to CM Devendra Fadnavis ahead of cabinet expansion - Hindustan Times
summary:
Aaditya Thackeray's request to CM Devendra Fadnavis ahead of cabinet expansion

Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Aaditya Thackeray has urged Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis to initiate an inquiry into a road scam targeting former CM Eknath Shinde ahead of the state cabinet expansion.

  • Aaditya Thackeray calls for the exclusion of Eknath Shinde and two other former ministers from the cabinet.
  • Thackeray alleges involvement in a ₹12,000 crore road scam, emphasizing the need for accountability.
  • He highlights concerns over a controversial 400 KM road concretisation project by BMC.
  • The inquiry request comes just before a scheduled cabinet expansion in Maharashtra.
"If the BJP government is serious about acting on the road scam, they must keep the then illegal CM Shinde and 2 guardian ministers of Shinde’s regime- Lodha and Kesarkar, out of the cabinet." - Aaditya Thackeray

The situation around the alleged road scam continues to evolve, with increasing calls for transparency and an investigation, as the government prepares for new appointments in the upcoming cabinet expansion.

title: 25-year-old biker killed after being hit by bus in Mumbai, days after deadly Kurla accident - Hindustan Times
summary:
25-year-old biker killed after being hit by bus in Mumbai, days after deadly Kurla accident

Date: December 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Days after a tragic accident in Kurla that claimed seven lives, a 25-year-old motorcyclist was killed when he was hit by a bus in Mumbai's Govandi area, prompting police to arrest the bus driver and conductor.

  • The accident occurred at the Shivaji Nagar junction in Govandi.
  • The victim, identified as Dikshit Vinod Rajput, suffered severe head injuries and was declared dead at Rajawadi Hospital.
  • The arrests were made under the relevant sections of the Bharatiya Nyay Sanhita (BNS) Act.
  • A previous bus accident in Kurla had resulted in seven fatalities and 42 injuries.
  • The driver of the bus involved in the Kurla incident was not fully trained to operate the electric vehicle.
“The incident claimed the lives of seven persons and highlighted serious training issues related to the operation of electric buses.”

This recent series of accidents underscores the urgent need for improved driver training and safety measures for public transport in Mumbai.

title: Delhi assembly polls: AAP's 4th list out, Kejriwal to contest from New Delhi - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi assembly polls: AAP's 4th list out, Arvind Kejriwal to contest from New Delhi

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 03:42 PM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has released its fourth and final candidate list for the 2025 Delhi assembly elections, featuring Arvind Kejriwal and Chief Minister Atishi as key candidates in their respective constituencies.

  • Arvind Kejriwal will contest from New Delhi, while Atishi will field from Kalkaji.
  • The list includes 38 candidates, among them, Saurabh Bharadwaj, Gopal Rai, Satyendra Kumar Jain, and Durgesh Pathak.
  • Assembly elections for the 70-member Delhi assembly are scheduled for February 2025.
  • Kejriwal has ruled out any pre-poll alliance with the Congress, stating AAP will rely on its own strength.
  • Other notable candidates include Saurabh Bharadwaj from Greater Kailash and Gopal Rai from Babarpur.
"AAP's 10 years of misrule have brought Delhi to the brink of ruin." - Parvesh Sahib Singh, BJP candidate for New Delhi

This election is poised to be competitive, with Kejriwal likely to face sons of two former chief ministers, indicating a high-stakes battle for power in Delhi.

title: Arvind Kejriwal, Atishi On 4th AAP List For Delhi Polls - NDTV
Maharashtra Cabinet expansion: Swearing-in ceremony in Nagpur today; over 30 MLAs to take oath - The Hindu
summary:
Maharashtra Cabinet expansion: Swearing-in ceremony in Nagpur today; over 30 MLAs to take oath

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The swearing-in ceremony for new Ministers in Maharashtra will take place today, marking a significant expansion of the State’s Cabinet with over 30 MLAs set to take their oaths.

  • The ceremony is scheduled for 4 p.m. at the Raj Bhavan in Nagpur.
  • The Cabinet expansion involves the ruling coalition Mahayuti, including the BJP, Shiv Sena, and NCP.
  • Over 30 MLAs are expected to be sworn in, with the Cabinet able to accommodate up to 43 members.
  • Distribution of Cabinet positions may include around 20 for BJP, 11-12 for Shiv Sena, and 9-10 for NCP.
  • This is the first swearing-in ceremony held in Nagpur in 33 years, since 1991.
  • Devendra Fadnavis is visiting Nagpur for the first time since taking office, coinciding with local celebrations of 'Dev Diwali'.
“Mr. Fadnavis is very particular that a few MLAs from Shiv Sena should not be part of his cabinet due to various reasons.”

This expansion and ceremony are crucial as the ruling coalition finalizes its power-sharing arrangements ahead of the upcoming Winter Session of the State legislature, emphasizing the ongoing negotiations and political dynamics within the coalition.

title: Shiv Sena MLAs scramble for berths ahead of Maharashtra cabinet expansion today | What we know so far - Hindustan Times
summary:
Shiv Sena MLAs scramble for berths ahead of Maharashtra cabinet expansion today | What we know so far

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: HT News Desk

The swearing-in ceremony of the Maharashtra cabinet is set for Sunday evening, following intense discussions among the BJP, Shiv Sena, and NCP after their recent electoral victory. The upcoming expansion will see Ministers vying for key positions amid strategic portfolio discussions.

  • The cabinet expansion, coming before the winter assembly session, is led by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis.
  • The BJP is expected to receive 20-21 ministerial positions, with Shiv Sena and NCP obtaining 11-12 and 9-10, respectively.
  • Intense competition exists within the Shiv Sena, particularly among MLAs seeking ministerial roles.
  • Former ministers are struggling to secure positions, while certain controversial figures face opposition from the BJP.
  • Other political dynamics include complaints about certain MLAs' behavior and past controversies.
  • The Mahayuti coalition achieved a sweeping victory in the November assembly elections, securing 230 out of 288 seats.
“30-32 ministers are likely to take oath on Sunday, including 20 BJP leaders and the rest from Shiv Sena.”

The upcoming cabinet expansion is crucial for the Mahayuti government as it aims to solidify its position following a significant electoral victory and address internal party dynamics and public expectations.

title: Explained| Impeachment Of A Sitting Judge: Procedure & Precedents - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Explained| Impeachment Of A Sitting Judge: Procedure & Precedents

Publication Date: December 13, 2023

Source: Live Law

Allahabad High Court Judge, Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav, is facing an impeachment motion in the Rajya Sabha due to controversial remarks he made about the Muslim community.

  • An impeachment motion against Justice Yadav was initiated by 55 MPs.
  • The Supreme Court sought details regarding his remarks following media coverage of the incident.
  • Impeachment involves parliamentary proceedings based on allegations of misconduct or incapacity.
  • The procedure for impeachment is defined in the Constitution of India and the Judges Inquiry Act 1968.
  • Impeachment requires a special majority in both houses of Parliament.
  • Previous attempts at impeachment in India have often failed due to lack of support.
“A Judge of the Supreme Court shall not be removed from his office except by an order of the President passed after an address by each House of Parliament supported by a majority of the total membership of that House and by a majority of not less than two-third of the members of the House present and voting.”

The impeachment process has historical context with only four formal attempts in independent India, highlighting the complexity and challenges faced during such proceedings.

title: Day after raids, ‘power theft worth Rs 1.3 crore by 4 mosques, 1 madrassa’ unearthed in Sambhal, claims district administration - The Indian Express
summary:
Day after raids, ‘power theft worth Rs 1.3 crore by 4 mosques, 1 madrassa’ unearthed in Sambhal, claims district administration

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

A day after raids were carried out in Uttar Pradesh’s Sambhal to check irregularities in electricity distribution in two localities, the district administration claimed that power theft worth Rs 1.3 crore by four mosques and a madrassa has been uncovered.

  • The raids revealed that significant electricity theft has occurred over the past year in the area, coinciding with efforts against power theft.
  • Sambhal District Magistrate Rajender Pensiya noted electricity theft during a loudspeaker check, prompting two raids involving multiple authorities.
  • Electricity worth around Rs 300 crore is supplied to Sambhal Nagar Palika area yearly, with line losses reported at 72%. In some areas, losses approach 85%.
  • 1,250 FIRs related to electricity theft have been lodged in the area since September.
  • An illegal power house was found supplying electricity to over 100 houses, with other methods of theft including tampered meters.
  • Measures to combat theft include laying 20 kilometres of armed wire, while dealing with encroachments and noise complaints simultaneously.
“In our drive to stop the electricity theft, we found that people use five to six ways… of these, a few methods are new to us. We never knew electricity could be stolen this way.” — Rajender Pensiya

The situation highlights extensive power theft that has been ongoing in Sambhal, with local authorities taking increased measures to combat this issue through raids and infrastructure improvement initiatives.

title: UP: Aarti performed after 46 years at ancient temple in Sambhal | Video - Hindustan Times
summary:
UP: Aarti performed after 46 years at ancient temple in Sambhal | Video

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 11:36 AM IST
Source: Hindustan Times

Aarti was performed for the first time in 46 years at the ancient Bhasma Shankar temple in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh, after it was reopened by local authorities recently.

  • The temple was discovered during an anti-encroachment drive, where officials found it houses deities Lord Shiva and Hanuman.
  • This centuries-old temple had been closed since the 1978 communal riots.
  • Local authorities have initiated measures to restore the temple and ensure its security, including the installation of CCTV cameras.
  • Officials plan to hand over the temple to the community it originally belonged to and take action against encroachments.
"A Brahmin should be appointed here so that he can stay here. Till the time caretaker is appointed, we will take responsibility." - Acharya Brahm Shukla

The reopening of the temple marks a significant moment for the local community, rekindling spiritual practices that had been dormant for decades and promising to restore the temple to its original state.

title: "If I Dig Up Parliament, Find Something...": A Owaisi On Mosque Surveys - NDTV
Kolkata Woman Beheaded, Chopped Into 3 Pieces For Rejecting Brother-In-Law - NDTV
summary:
Kolkata Woman Beheaded, Chopped Into 3 Pieces For Rejecting Brother-In-Law

Publication Date: December 15, 2024 | Source: NDTV

A woman in her 30s in Kolkata was brutally murdered by her brother-in-law after she rejected his romantic advances. The victim's body was found chopped into three pieces and scattered in different locations.

  • The victim, a domestic helper, was strangled, beheaded, and dismembered by her brother-in-law.
  • The severed head was found in a polythene bag, leading to the discovery of the rest of the body parts.
  • The accused, Atiur Rahman Laskar, confessed to the crime, revealing that he was enraged by the victim's rejection.
  • Police investigations, including the use of sniffer dogs and CCTV footage, led to Laskar's arrest in his native village.
"The victim had started avoiding Laskar and even blocked his phone number. This rejection enraged him." - Deputy Commissioner of Police Bidisha Kalita

The brutal murder highlights the extreme consequences of unrequited love and the importance of timely intervention in cases of harassment and stalking.

title: 'Abusing power as CM': Karnataka BJP chief hits back at Siddaramaiah on corruption allegations - Hindustan Times
summary:
Abusing power as CM: Karnataka BJP chief hits back at Siddaramaiah on corruption allegations

Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) Karnataka chief BY Vijayendra has responded to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, who alleged Vijayendra's involvement in a corruption case and called for a CBI investigation.

  • Siddaramaiah accused Vijayendra of attempting to bribe Anwar Manippady with ₹150 crore to suppress investigations.
  • The CM demanded a CBI inquiry into the allegations against the BJP leader.
  • Vijayendra questioned Siddaramaiah's moral authority to demand an investigation given his own corruption allegations.
  • The BJP leader criticized Siddaramaiah for his handling of previous CBI and ED investigations.
  • Siddaramaiah claimed that BJP has turned Karnataka into its "ATM."
"What morality do you have to order a CBI investigation into someone else, humiliated by the High Court verdict?" - BY Vijayendra

This heated exchange highlights the ongoing political tussle in Karnataka, with both parties hurling allegations of corruption at each other as the call for an independent investigation gains momentum.

title: Bengaluru cop dies by suicide alleging harassment by wife, father-in-law - The Indian Express
summary:
Bengaluru cop dies by suicide alleging harassment by wife, father-in-law

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

A police head constable in Bengaluru died by suicide on Friday night, alleging harassment by his wife and father-in-law. This tragic incident raises concerns about domestic issues leading to severe outcomes.

  • The deceased, Thippanna Alugur, was a head constable at the Hulimavu police station.
  • Alugur left a death note accusing his wife, Parvathi, and her father, Yamunappa, of harassment.
  • The incident follows another recent suicide case involving harassment in Bengaluru.
  • A heated argument reportedly occurred before his death, which involved abusive communication from Yamunappa.
  • Alugur's mother has lodged a complaint leading to legal action against his wife and father-in-law.
“Yamunappa had asked him to die or else he would ‘finish him off.’”

This case highlights the serious implications of domestic abuse and the urgent need for support systems for individuals facing such stress. Mental health and social welfare interventions are crucial in preventing similar tragedies in the future.
